content: this is my first attempt at creating a pattern it was based on necessity… i love rectangular wraps as opposed to v shaped with a slightly more organic look by that i mean a little less structured than a lace pattern **originally knit in lang mille colori - colour #21** **i recently found the icelandic b/o 1 to be an easy & stretchy option** blocked to 60 by 13 one of the things i like about this pattern is when i am using different yarns or multiple yarns i can tell how wide it is at half way and add more row if need be… even add a different stitch section in the middle if need be yardage needed may vary designer used 6 skeins of the pattern yarn or 600 yds **row 23 help k3 k5 yo k1 yox2 k1 yox3 k1 yox2 k1 yo k6* 22 repeats but change the last repeat to k6 to k3 so this is a bit more of a breakdown k3 k5 =8 sts yo k1 yo2 k1 yo3 k1 yo2 k1 yo k6 repeat 21x = 399 then yo k1 yox2 k1 yox3 k1 yox2 k1 yo k3 = 16 8 + 399 +16=423 sts** **french version** supplied by amelie - **sorry link no longer works** **danish version** supplied by marianneho - https //strikkeglad dk/23739/sjal-med-moensterborter/ 3 **spanish version** supplied by lourdes - link text 4 note- i cannot answer any questions regarding the french danish or spanish versions 1 https //www youtube com/watch v=xzot7h73_68 2 http //www filaparis com/ 3 https //strikkeglad dk/23739/sjal-med-moensterborter/ 4 https //www mygranny es/talleres/patron-chal-sampler/
